item.title: What's Been Up in SDS348
item.description: Every time I tell people that my major is computational biology, I’m met with blank stares as I attempt to answer their questions about this field. So, for my first post, I’ll actually show everyone some of what compuational biologists do. About In my Computational Biology and Bioinformatics course (SDS348), we dove into topics of data visualization, probability functions, data manipulation and wrangling, matrices, distances, associations, clustering, PCA, hypothesis testing, simulation, ANOVA, MANOVA, PERMANOVA, linear regression, logistic regression, binary classification, cross validation and regularization.
